Articles.Content:
This is my take on the ancient kerbal mythology, and what the planets are named after. :

Kerbol: King of the gods, in a constant battle with Minimus and Muna (the proper name for the Mun) for control of the heavens, the explanation for day and night. Moho’s dad.

Minimus: goddess of the forest, plants, grass, and, later on in her history, ice cream (according to ancient legend a warrior/chef found her foraging for ingredients on a icy mountain and beat her in a cooking contest, winning the recipe).

Muna: goddess of rock, stone metal and all other forms of non precious metals and rocks. Famous for providing light in the dark, and being a very skilled fighter.

Duna: god of the desert, dunes, old age, drought, and rust. Known for being a bit annoying, messing with mortals, and not being friendly at all.

Ike: The aforementioned warrior/chef, eventually promoted to being the demigod of snacks, inventor of: chips, sugar, and bubblegum, which he originally intended as an adhesive. Works to combat Duna’s droughts and hunger.

Moho: god of fire, speed, volcanoes and propulsion. (Kerbals invented basic solid rocket fuel very early in their development.) Very friendly and helpful, unless you anger him.

Eve: goddess of war, pain, and the underworld (the bad afterlife in this case) Angry, vicious and all around horrible.

Gilly: enemy of Eve, guard of the good afterlife, god of peace, and victory.

The kraken: Eve’s pet, invisible, deadly, and everywhere. Sometimes referred to as the god of murder, crime and death.

Jool: goddess of precious metals, beauty, love and also the creator of kerbals.

Vall: daughter of Jool, goddess of water, rain, and ice.

Pol: son of Jool, cursed by Eve to be the god of ugliness, still loved by his family.

Bop: youngest son of Jool, god of childhood and flight. Once held ransom by Eve, leaving a small monster on his back.

Tylo: oldest son of Jool, god of adulthood, beer, and work.

Laythe: twin sister of Kerbin, also one of Jool’s daughters, goddess of the ocean, fish, and boats.

Kerbin: goddess of home, land, animals, and rovers.

Eeloo: god of the good part of the afterlife, Gilly’s dad, and also the god of rewards and happiness.

 

Ksp 2:

Rask and Rusk: twin gods of the hunt and cooking.

Debdeb: god of exploration, curiosity and hard work, very important in the kerbal pantheon.

 

(that’s all for now.)

Edited December 15, 2021 by Hyperspace Industries
Moar deities!

Glumo: goddess of marriage, divorce, and weirdly enough, donuts.

Ovin: god of punishment, and justice, famous for trapping people at the bottom of wells with weights tied to their feet, imprisoning them, and all around trapping people.

Charr: Angered Moho, got trapped at the edge of a volcano, constantly being burnt.

On 12/15/2021 at 8:46 AM, Hyperspace Industries said:

twin gods of the hunt and cooking.

Do the other gods like their food?

I just love your pantheon! Maybe you should add this to Vall:

''Has a weird temple on her, offered by Jool to prevent her from being ejected by her siblings Laythe and Tylo,,

You should do the outer planets mod, they have very stockalike planets.

Also, maybe come up with some non-planet mythological creatures/people.
